result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The Defendant, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under Wisconsin statutes Sect. 941.29 under the Wisconsin Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.   "A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,  obtaining a firearm/body armor."
Participate in all referrals, treatment and programming deemed appropriate by the risk assessment or the supervising agent.  Complete psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.
No contact with T.M.P.    Note:  Under Wisconsin State Statute 6.03(1)(b) as person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored
Submit a DNA sample.  Take all medications prescribed in the amount and manner directed by the prescribing physician.

Minutes Filed
Plea hearing on July 6, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Letters/correspondence
Exhibit 1

Defendant Robert Eugene Poch in court in custody, with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Annie Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is a continued motion hearing; motion to suppress originating from August 29, 2016.  The Court has reviewed the transcript and disc from original motion hearing.  Atty Latzig; client was in custody.  Atty Jay will be recalling Warden Cadotte to continue testimony.  Atty Latzig, no objection to not play disc.
Kyle Cadotte sworn and questioned by Atty Jay.  Witness identifies Robert Poch, Jr.  Spoke with Robert's brother's wife at their residence; then spoke w/Michael and then w/Robert; Robert agreed to come down to the station to talk; describes transportation to the station and who transported; Robert chose to ride with Officer Benton in his vehicle, not hand cuffed, not searched at this time, volunteered to go with officers; did not tell Robert he had to go into the police department.  Brought Robert into the interview room at the station; unsure if weapon was visible during the interview; neither removed weapon from holster; Robert not handcuffed during the interview, or told he was under arrest during the interview; door into the interview room was open during the interview; door could be locked from the outside of the room; Robert was not threatened or promised anything for his interview.  Cross by Atty Latzig; officers did not leave residence and came back, went to residence 01-16-2016 about 6 p.m.; both officers we at the residence; vehicles were at the end of the driveway; traveling distance from residence to station took 5 min; unknown if Robert was able to get out of squad on his own; interview room appox. 12x14, no windows, only one door; Robert brought up issue w/having an Atty. re: being served; Exhibit #1 marked, transcript of interview of Robert Poch, witness reviews pages 7 and 8 of transcript; Robert talked about Atty. for TPC of daughter, brought up using statements against him; he was informed he did not have to answer questions.  Re-direct by AAG Jay; Robert indicated his brother told him what he says can be used against him.  Witness excused by the Court.  State has no further witnesses.  Court receives exhibit #1.  No witnesses by the defense.
Argument by AAG Jay.  Argument by Atty Latzig; 2 violations of constitutional rights of Mr. Poch; asks the Court suppress statements.  Rebuttal by AAG Jay; page 8 of the interview transcript officers tell Mr. Poch he does not have to talk with them.
Court; reviewed interview and transcript and listened to testimony and argument; law enforcement were gathering information; miranda rights-in custody?-not searched, not handcuffed, not secure portion of station where he was brought; Mr. Poch was not in custody when the interview was started; pressures by l.e., voluntary statements?-brother told him he could have Atty present and could be quiet, silence cannot be used against him, officer did not take the questions too far, officer did try to repair a mis-spoken comment, Mr. Poch gave no indication he wanted to stop the questioning; Statements made by Mr. Poch were voluntary; statements will not be suppressed.
AAG Jay offer made and is open for 7 days from today; asks for TSC in about 10 days, Atty Latzig is requesting JT late September or October.  Attys ask for 3-day JT, or TSC in 7-10 days.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits #1 and #2 marked by the State prior to motion hearing beginning. Defendant Robert Eugene Poch in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody, and appears in person.  Motion to Suppress Statements, Shiffer, Motion in Limine for Defense; Latzig, not going forward with Shiffer motion.  State has Motion in Limine and Motion for Reconsideration.  DA indicates they were anticipating Daubert Hearing; 08-23-2016 rec'd report from defense expert witness; need to find an expert for the State.  Court discusses w/ Attys the order the motions are heard today; Daubert Hearing very difficult to schedule based on the Courts' calendar.  DA informs the Court of recent case law from June, 2016 due to relevent testimony; not prepared to do Daubert Hearing today; inquires if Daubert Hearing could be heard during time period of JT.  Latzig does not oppose request for Daubert Hearing during JT period.  Court; leave this option open.
State informs additional 908.08 motion filed 02-04-2016; Latzig motion in limine responds to the State's motion.
Motion to Suppress:  State calls Christopher Benton; witness is sworn and questioned by DA.  Employed w/R.C.P.D. since 2012.  Officer Nye began investigation on this case; met Mr. Poch with A.C. Cadotte at Mr. Poch's home; recorded contact with Mr. Poch; State requests to play exhibit #1-approximately 5 min.; Court questions if State has reduced recording to transcribed text; Court will research issue; questions DA; Court relieves court reporter from taking down the evidence presented in exhibit #1.  At 1:58 of the recording stopped and witness questioned by DA.  At 3:17 of the recording stopped and witness questioned by DA; identifies defendant.  At 5:00 of the recording stopped and witness questioned by DA.  Brought Mr. Poch to the interview room at the R.C.P.D.; informed him he was free to leave at any time; A.C. Kyle Cadotte interviewed Mr. Poch.  Cross by Latzig.  Unsure if the CARES interview had taken place at the point of the interview w/ Mr. Poch.  No Re-direct by DA; offers exhibit #1, Court receives w/ no objection by Latzig.
Kyle Cadotte sworn and questioned by DA.  Worked in L.E. since July, 2011; previously assistant chief for the R.C.P.D.  Notified by Officer Nye of allegations; spoke w/ Officer Benton at approximately 5 p.m. and made arrangements to meet him at Mr. Poch's home.  Mr. Poch was advised he did not need to come with the officers; his van was not working at the time; met back at the R.C.P.D. for the interview w/Mr. Poch; audio recording on Officer Cadotte was recording as well as the a/v recording in the interview room; exhibit #2 played by DA begins at 6:51:19 pm on 01-17-2016; Court is unable to hear the recording; recording stopped and offered by DA.  Exhibit #3 marked for DA; recording stopped at :40 to question the witness; recording stopped at 5:14, Latzig objects to balance of the recording, remainder is irrelevent; violation of 5th amendment rights.  Court asks DA to continuing playing the recording; Court asks DA to stop recording at 7:45, questions DA why no transcript was prepared of the recording; Court needs a transcript of the recording, does not have a proper record, having difficulty hearing the recording.  DA will have transcript prepared.  Court leaves the motion to suppress open for the time being.  DA requests ability to continue direct exam on this witness for the future; Court agrees.  Latzig requires the decision on this motion before date of JT.  DA responds.  Court discusses issues w/Attys in proceeding w/JT dates as scheduled.  Court excuses witness from the stand.
908.08 motion of the State; CARE interview of victim, transcript has been filed; age of victim is under 12.  DA offers his copy of transcript to the Court.  Latzig informs the Court she has rec'd a copy of the transcript.  DA informs the Court that the Child was placed under oath, questioned about truth and a lie and consequences.  Latzig; 908.08 (2)(b), no name or business address of camera operator; (3) findings listed, audio distorted; hard to understand the child; forenzic copy appeared to be edited for volume enhancements; (3)(c) punishment for not telling the truth.  DA responds; age at interview was 9; interviewer informing child she needed to speak up; enhancement of volume intended to bring out child's voice; no changes made in recording or effort to cover up parts of the recording; child was soft spoken.  Latzig does agree with this.  DA informs the Court the operator was Haley Nye, R.C. Officer.  Oath was given to child, page 3.  Court takes a break.  Back on the record.  DA, did not find the actual oath for child in the transcript, just discussion about telling the truth.  State has complied w/stats; child will be present for cross by defense; request child be able to testify by closed circuit.  Latzig responds; stats required both informing and understanding of telling the truth.  Court-908.08 motion; 9 yrs old at interview; opinion information re: camera operator has been given to defense at this point; child was asked about truth and lie, she understood and agreed to tell the truth; recording enhanced, not edited/altered, appears to be accurate and complete and provided to defense some time ago; spirit of the stats the recording has static but not intended to cover up statements, transcript is provided of the interview; allows 908.08 motion.  
Motion for testimony outside of courtroom, DA comments to the Court.  Latzig objects.  DA responds, recites case law.  Court: allow child to testify by closed circuit w/some kind of proof of mental harm from a family member.  
Motions in Limine; # of previous convictions for impeachment, two prior conviction.  Latzig argues.  Court: # of prior convictions will be 2, Latzig retains right to renew objection.
Seq. of witnesses granted.  DA may ask for Officer Cadotte as Agent, Latzig has no objection.  Latzig informs the Court she may still obtain discovery.  
Motion to Reconsider can be dealt with at the same time as the Daubert Motion; Court informs Attys when the request to ext. time was granted, JA was on vacation so may not have been relayed to DA.  DA questions the Court if it is necessary to reschedule JT, what timeframe would parties be looking at?  Court: not sure this case could be completed within 3 days considering the need to still address the open motions.  DA responds, not asking for the JT to be rescheduled, asks for TSC later this week; Remove JT from the September dates.  DA informs there may be add'l motion to be filed.  Latzig requests add'l time to respond.
  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Verbal Request by DA during Arraignment held 03-29-2016
Minutes Filed
Minutes Filed
Brief in support of state's response to defendant's motion to dismiss
Defendant's brief in support of motion to dismiss the criminal complaint
State's response to defense motion to dismiss
Exhibit 1 - preliminary hearing
Arraignment at 03-22-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Robert Eugene Poch in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Dismiss presented by Atty Latzig.  DA has filed response.  Court reviews documents.  Latzig argues her motion; lack of specificity in dates and times of offenses.  DA responds; recites cases pertaining to this issue; charge is repeated sexual assault of child victim; age of child and her ability to remember dates; complaint does cite a period of time.  COA case recently decided is referenced.  Offers printed case law to the Court.  Due process of Defendant have not been violated.  Latzig responds; reasonable test and if this case falls within the wholesome test.  DA, Defense has the burden in their motion; no allegations or lack of elements presented by the Defense.  Latzig, willing to prepare brief on issue.  Court asks if parties want to brief.  Latzig responds she would like to brief and will be filed within 2 weeks.  DA requests 1 week to respond after Defense brief filed.  Court:  Latzig to file brief by 03-09-2016, State response by 03-16-2016.  
PH:  DA asks Officer Cadotte be allowed as Agent.  Haley Nye sworn and questioned by DA.  Works for R.C. PD; knows Mr. Poch and identifies defendant.  Investigation of child sexual assault, contacted 01-16-2016.  Contacted ICW and DHS to set up CARES interview.  Exhibit #1 marked; Officer Nye report identified by witness.  Interview took place in the R.C. PD Office and was recorded by video.  Child is T.P. and is 9 years old at time of interview.  Child described acts of defendant toward her.  DA offers Exhibit #1; objected by Latzig; overruled and received by the Court.  Ass't Chief Kyle Cadotte was contacted and was involved with the interview of Robert Poch, defendant.  Cross by Latzig.  No re-direct by DA.
Kyle Cadotte sworn and questioned by DA.  Works for R.C. PD, involved in investigation of Robert Poch, defendant.  Interview w/ Robert Poch took place 01-17-2016 at the R.C. PD office with Officer Benton and Officer Cadotte.  Mr. Poch made specific admissions during the interview, child would have been around 7 years old when incidents began, defendant admitted to 3 incidents during the interview.  No further witnesses from either side.
Argument by DA.  Asks for Bind Over.
Argument by Latzig, Asks for Dismissal of Case.
Court:  Based on testimony and exhibit #1 there is sufficient evidence that a felony was committed and defendant was involved with the felony.  Probable cause is found and defendant is bound over.  Mr. Poch will be in court in person for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's motion to dismiss: defective complaint
